data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: We do not want the men of another color for our brothers-in-law, but we do want them for our brothers.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: One man cannot hold another man down in the ditch without remaining down in the ditch with him.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: I shall allow no man to belittle my soul by making me hate him.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: If you can't read, it's going to be hard to realize dreams.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: At the bottom of education, at the bottom of politics, even at the bottom of religion, there must be for our race economic independence.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has had to overcome while trying to succeed.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: No race can prosper till it learns that there is as much dignity in tilling a field as in writing a poem.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Success in life is founded upon attention to the small things rather than to the large things; to the every day things nearest to us rather than to the things that are remote and uncommon.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Character is power.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: There is no power on earth that can neutralize the influence of a high, simple and useful life.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: There are two ways of exerting one's strength: one is pushing down, the other is pulling up.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: You can't hold a man down without staying down with him.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: We must reinforce argument with results.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: No man, who continues to add something to the material, intellectual and moral well-being of the place in which he lives, is left long without proper reward.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Nothing ever comes to one, that is worth having, except as a result of hard work.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Character, not circumstances, makes the man.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: The individual who can do something that the world wants done will, in the end, make his way regardless of his race.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Excellence is to do a common thing in an uncommon way.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: No greater injury can be done to any youth than to let him feel that because he belongs to this or that race he will be advanced in life regardless of his own merits or efforts.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Few things can help an individual more than to place responsibility on him, and to let him know that you trust him.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: Dignify and glorify common labor. It is at the bottom of life that we must begin, not at the top.

data.author: Booker T. Washington
data.en: To hold a man down, you have to stay down with him.
